intro: Diplycosia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
